org.jscripter.emu.java.lang
Class Short

java.lang.Object
  org.jscripter.emu.java.lang.Number
      org.jscripter.emu.java.lang.Short
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Short>
public final class Short
extends Number
implements Comparable<Short>

Internally represents primitive short values, emulating a standard java.lang interface or class with the same simple name as this one.

This interface or class is only used internally by JS re-compiler implementations.

Please refer to the Java API Standards for detail description of the original class or interface.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must redirect the resolution of the emulated original Java class or interface to this one.

JavaScript:

Short

public Short(java.lang.String s)

Allocates a Short representing the value indicated by the string parameter.

The string is converted to a short value in exactly the manner used by the parseShort(String) method for radix 10.

Parameters:
s - A string to be converted to a Short.
Throws:
NumberFormatException - if the string does not contain a parsable short.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this constructor. A re-compiler simply replaces an invocation of this constructor with an invocation of valueOf(String) passing the string argument.
Method Detail

decode

public static final java.lang.Short decode(java.lang.String s)
                                    throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

Decodes a string into a Short.

Parameters:
s - A string to decode.
Returns:
A Short represented by s.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the string does not contain a parsable short.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method. As a "synchronized" static emulating method, its invocation should be re-compiled into in-lined code for efficiency.

parseShort

public static final short parseShort(java.lang.String s)
                              throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

Parses the string argument as a signed decimal short.

The characters in the string must all be decimal digits, except that the first character may be an ASCII minus sign '-' ('-') to indicate a negative value. The resulting short value is returned, exactly as if the argument and the radix 10 were given as arguments to the parseShort(String, int) method.

Parameters:
s - A string containing the short representation to be parsed.
Returns:
The Short represented by the string argument in decimal.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the string does not contain a parsable short.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method. As a "synchronized" static emulating method, its invocation should be re-compiled into in-lined code for efficiency.

parseShort

public static final short parseShort(java.lang.String s,
                                     int radix)
                              throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

Parses the string argument as a signed short in the radix specified by the second argument.

The characters in the string must all be digits, of the specified radix (as determined by whether Character.digit(char, int) returns a nonnegative value) except that the first character may be an ASCII minus sign '-' ('-') to indicate a negative value. The resulting short value is returned.

Parameters:
s - A string containing the short representation to be parsed.
radix - The radix to be used while parsing s.
Returns:
The Short represented by the string argument in the specified radix.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the string does not contain a parsable short.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method. As a "synchronized" static emulating method, its invocation should be re-compiled into in-lined code for efficiency.

reverseBytes

public static final short reverseBytes(short s)

Returns the value obtained by reversing the order of the bytes in the two's complement representation of the specified short value.

Parameters:
s - A short to be converted.
Returns:
The value obtained by reversing (or, equivalently, swapping) the bytes in the specified value.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method.

toString

public static final java.lang.String toString(short s)

Returns a string representing the specified short. The radix is assumed to be 10.

Parameters:
s - A short to be converted.
Returns:
The string representation of the specified short.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method. As a "synchronized" static emulating method, its invocation should be re-compiled into in-lined code for efficiency.

compareTo

public final int compareTo(Short s)

Compares two Shorts numerically.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable<Short>
Parameters:
s - The Short to be compared.
Returns:
0 if this Short is equal to the argument Short; a value less than 0 if this Short is numerically less than the argument Short; and a value greater than 0 if this Short is numerically greater than the argument Short (signed comparison).
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method. For efficiency, the invocation of this instance emulation method with single statement can be in-lined in re-compilation.

equals

public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)

Compares this Short to the specified object.

Returns true if and only if the argument is not null and is a Short that represents the same value as this Short.

Overrides:

Parameters:
o - The object to compare with.
Returns:
true if the Shorts represent the same value; false otherwise.

toString

public final java.lang.String toString()

Returns a string representing this Short's value.

The value is converted to signed decimal representation and returned as a string, exactly as if the short value were given as an argument to the toString(short) method.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A string representation of this Short in base 10.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method.
